answers.a: No—potassium sorbate (E202) is a sorbate preservative, not a sulfite; E225 refers to sulfite salts such as potassium sulfite used as antioxidants/preservatives.

answers.q: 17. what forms when hydrochloric acid and potassium sulfite react?
answers.a: Acidifying potassium sulfite (E225) with hydrochloric acid releases sulfur dioxide (SO2) and produces potassium chloride and water.

answers.q: amountof potassium sulfite to use when racking wine
answers.a: Aim to maintain about 20–40 mg/L free SO2 (pH-dependent); winemakers usually use potassium metabisulfite, but if using potassium sulfite (E225), add an SO2‑equivalent dose to reach that target.

answers.q: canon mf4350d system error e225 solution when i try to print
answers.a: That “E225” is a printer error code and unrelated to the food additive E225, which is a sulfite preservative.

answers.q: e225 equals what in american money
answers.a: E225 is a food additive code, not a currency amount, so it doesn’t convert to US dollars.
